caption: I had a hot chocolate with a delicious chocolate croissant. Great atmosphere, great food. 10/10.

A great spot when you need to grab anything quickly. The sandwiches are delicious and I always enjoy their pre-made meals as well. I have tried just about everything here and have yet to be disappointed.

Been going here since they opened this location. It holds a special place in my heart, so I do love it personally. Prices can sometimes feel high for things like frozen goods and alcohol, but for actual groceries, I feel like they're great. I also feel like their meat and fish prices are some of the best around! It's also worth mentioning that they are Korean-owned (I'm like 90% sure), so they carry a number of harder to find Korean and Asian products. Worth coming for well-priced groceries and for Asian products, I'd say. Otherwise, probably better elsewhere, tbh.  Their deli/hot food/kitchen/'cafe'/whatever you wanna call it is alright. Sushi is well priced and I've like it in the past. I've had their wings, subs, and the Reuben. All their food here used to be leagues better, and that is no exaggeration. It's just okay right now. Above average, maybe?  As for COVID-19 concerns, they're pretty up-to-par. I myself take more precautions than I see most people taking, and I feel okay coming here.
Best coffee in town! Super friendly and convenient.
Love this corner market
Love this place!  Intelligently run, good people.  They have a nice selection of things.  Good coffee and sandwiches.
The food is good—consistently good, quick and affordable. It's perfect for an easy lunch and there's a number of choices. Great go to place to eat. And, the service is great too!
good selection!!
Great breakfast sandwiches and pastries. Service reminds me why I choose urban living. Phenomenal!!
Great place to pick up a bite or a few things for the house
Awesome!  Love this store

Phenomenal local market with a great selection of food options. Good place to grab breakfast/lunch or pick up some healthy and unique groceries. Awesome service, and their mission supporting local entrepreneurs is really cool. Whatever you came in looking for, you’ll leave here satisfied.
Yummy GF beeakfast
(Translated by Google) Great salad 🥗 😊  (Original) Super la salade 🥗 😊
Fun grocery store with everything you need! Also great breakfast options! Inside and outside seating!
Amazing service...kudos to Mr Sean who was so good in his approach .
They had delicious food made quickly. I had the BLT Avocado sandwich and a side of roasted brussels sprouts - very good!
Really great sandwiches. Nice shop with some cool local items, gourmet treats and more.
Great little local market with some fresh prepared food options.
Great avocado sandwich for breakfast, coupled with Compass coffee. This was great to find after finding out the Compass coffee stand disappeared from the Convention Center.
Nice
I am only reviewing the over the food service, not the grocery part. The food was decent, but what bummed me out was the short selection of tea / coffee. The menu wasn't terribly long either.

Really nice local market with fantastic sandwiches. Always smells fantastic and has interesting snacks to choose from. Great location next to convention center as well, and I like how late they stay open. Very convenient.
Great place for coffee. Love the egg and avocado sandwich. Doesn't get too crowded. I've been meaning to check out the pizza too!

Cashier was stand offish when trying to order food. Didn’t even look at us and when they did, very passive aggressive attitude. I asked a question and she didn’t respond to my question. First time visiting here. Not sure if I’ll come back again.
Awesome
The rice was not good, maybe it was from the morning and I buy it at night and the cashier didnt mind.... Sorry two stars

I live in the neighborhood.  I never shop here because they never have what I need, not even the basics.  I gave it another try today, I needed whole milk.  They did not have any on the shelf.  I asked the staff if they had any whole milk.  They said they had one.  I asked if I could buy it.  They said they couldn’t sell it to me because they needed it for coffee tomorrow.  Which is infuriating, why tell me you have it available when you don’t.  And how can a grocery not have milk?
Outstanding
Great neighborhood place, can be a little pricey for standard groceries, but if you need beer/wine/coffee/snacks or cute gifts, it's perfect for that!
Love their SANDWICHES!  Avocado BLT on Potato Roll👊🏽
The bacon egg and avocado sandwich (I added goat cheese) was easily one of the best sandwiches I've ever eaten!  I will be back soon.  Folks seemed friendly as well.
Not your everyday local market. A really nice change of pace. Many locally made products.  Great service!
Not a lot variety
Super cool local grocery store in Shaw. Great hot bar and coffee shop with local items. Definitely check them out if in the neighborhood.
Great atmosphere. Food is great.
Good store
Lovely
Had two isles for groceries and one was entirely beer and wine. Had a great pizza but wished it live up to its name as a grocery store.
Loved the sandwich I got from there. Chini chicken I think it was called. Cute little place!!
Fantastic key lime pie
I got a salad and got several pieces of rotten peppers in there - disappointing
Great casual cafe options, with tons of other grocery options. Great place to sit and relax as well.
Great lunch spot, great service, and great snacks
Friendly quick service and delicious breakfast sandwich. We have already decided where we are having breakfast tomorrow - back at Union Kitchen!
Great little spot to pick up some staple items, a nitro cold brew or a killer breakfast sando!
Cool store with an eclectic selection
Really excellent food options and very friendly staff

Part of Union Market, this great little gem in the heart of shaw! Small (but yum!) salad bar, with delicious and customizable sandwiches and toasts. I personally recommend the salmon toast (and swapping the cream cheese with avocado). As for the groceries, you can expect local goods (made and produced in DC) and lots of healthy (and often vegan!) options. Keep in mind that this place is small and gets crowded fast! Go at a random time (3 pm?) to avoid lines and crowds.
Good place to grab a quick snack.
Beautiful food, very nicely renovated too!
A cool place for artisanal products
Unique market that gives vibes of Brooklyn. Love this spot, plenty of unique products by small business owners.

Pros: Brioche breakfast sandwiches are awesome. Best chocolate chip cookies anywhere. Cold brew coffee and tea. Good selection of yuppie groceries.  Cons: Too much dill on the salmon toast. Some of the staff were still training. Sandwich guy seemed unhappy.

Excellent service, selection and quality. Extra cool social entrepreneurship through their incubator kitchen approach. I had a delicious lunch from the prepared foods at the salad bar. And I had a really superb cortado made by a very thoughtful staff person who made sure to try the specific coffee before serving me since she hadn’t brewed it in a while. 1 single stall bathroom.
Prepared food, salad bar, coffee bar, and great grocery selections.

Absolutely stunned by this place. I have never been treated with such disrespect. The woman at the register was extremely rude towards the three of us. The chef was rude as well. I ordered a hot cocoa and it was all foam! I went to the register and explained to her that my hot cocoa was all foam. Immediately she got defensive and the chef stepped in and was rude. I was ganged up on by 2 employees for asking a questions about their hot cocoa. The chef said make a new one for her and then the woman at the register said no and completely ignored me. I walked away pissed. I sat down and a few minutes later there was a new hot cocoa. I refused it, because I will not accept anything from a place that is so rude. I highly recommend anyone to NOT go here. Yes the owner tried to make it better, but she did not have her employees apologize. As a visitor of this area, this is the worst customer service experience I have ever had. I will be happily reporting this to Zagat, Google and all other review platforms.
What a gem!  We just had lunch but it was nearly perfect.
Awesome local grocery!
Great place to shop and have great food selections

Union Kitchen Grocery, while expensive, has without a doubt one of the best customer service I have ever experienced. I truly believe Sean (Shawn)(?) the cashier cares about the individuals he is helping. I just moved to the area and my mother, who helped me moved, was leery about the area, but after her encounter with the cashier at Union Kitchen Grocery has changed her tune. Thank you for the awesome service and the delicious drinks!
Love local one stop shop!
Great selection of food staples, garlic, shallots, wine, beer and takeout. Lots of chilled wines priced around $15 range which is excellent. Did not try indian food but it looked delicious!

Has everything I'd normally get from Whole Foods, but it's a small store, so it's a much more pleasant shopping experience.  They have great wines chilling and ready-made food, so perfect to hit up before a picnic or dinner party.
I grabbed some yummy stuff here while staying at a local hotel, rather than another restaurant meal.
Union Kitchen is changing the food industry for the better.
Extraordinary food for take out, wonderful coffee. A gem!!
Great locally owned market with awesome breakfast, lunch, and dinner options. They also have an espresso bar and lots of great local products.
